title: The Romance Between The American Right, Russia And Putin
description:
For half a century, during the Cold War, every U-S president painted Russia as the dominant threat. America's ideological opposite, a hostile and nuclear-armed power. Ronald Reagan went so far as to call the Soviet Union an Evil Empire.

So the events of recent days have been noteworthy. On top of a holdup of U-S aid for Ukraine, former President Trump said he might NOT come to the defense of a NATO ally who hadn't spent enough on defense.

And Tucker Carlson, the erstwhile Fox news host, flew to Moscow to sit down with Vladimir Putin for more than two hours of mostly softball questions.

Afterward, he pronounced Putin "impressive" on stage at the World Government Summit.

So what gives? Why the romance between the American right and Russia?

For sponsor-free episodes of Consider This, sign up for Consider This+ via Apple Podcasts or at plus.npr.org.

title: How NYC is coping with 175,000 migrants from the Southern border
description: New York Times reporter Andy Newman says the city's legal mandate to provide shelter to any who need it is being tested by a stream of migrants — some of whom were sent on buses by Southern governors.

title: Ebola vaccine cuts death rates in half — even if it's given after infection
description: Ebola is one of the most feared infectious diseases, with more than half of those infected dying. A vaccine has now been shown to cut that mortality rate in half.

title: DOJ watchdog finds 187 inmate suicides in federal prisons over 8-year period
description: The watchdog's reporting comes in the wake of several high-profile deaths in federal lockups in recent years, most notably the murder James "Whitey" Bulger and the suicide of Jeffrey Epstein.

title: Abortion pills that patients got via telehealth and the mail are safe, study finds
description: The study looks at 6,000 patients who got abortion pills after an online appointment. It found that 99.7% of those abortions were not followed by any serious adverse events.

title: Trump's New York hush money trial will start March 25
description: The judge in the hush money case against Donald Trump has rejected the former president's attempt to dismiss the charges, and a jury trial will begin as originally scheduled on March 25.

title: Latino Democrats launch "Our Lucha" war room using Spanglish to combat GOP
description: The campaign arm of the Congressional Hispanic Caucus is calling the new effort "Our Lucha War Room," or their fight for Latinos and boosting their  representation in Congress.

title: 1 killed at Chiefs parade shooting; Russia is developing a space-based nuclear device
description: A shooting at the Kansas City Chiefs Super Bowl parade killed one woman and injured at least 21 others, including children. Russia is developing a nuclear capability that could target satelites.

title: Israeli forces enter main hospital in southern Gaza after prolonged standoff
description: The raid came a day after the army sought to evacuate thousands of displaced people who had taken shelter at the Nasser Hospital in Khan Younis.

title: Could vacant office spaces across the U.S. be the solution to a national problem?
description: A recent study calculated that about a fifth of U.S. office space was vacant at the end of last year. What is the fate of all this empty real estate?

title: Chicago will drop controversial ShotSpotter gunfire detection system
description: Chicago Mayor Brandon Johnson followed through on his campaign promise by announcing the city won't renew the contract for the system, which critics have called ineffective and costly.

title: Trump is rattling Europe. Now Harris is going there to try to calm nervous allies
description: Vice President Harris is making a major address on Friday at the Munich Security Conference. But European leaders are alarmed at the U.S. failure to keep its promise to continue to back Ukraine.

title: Russia is developing nuclear capability to threaten satellites, source says
description: The full extent of the threat is unclear as the details remain classified. National security adviser Jake Sullivan is expected to brief a small group of lawmakers on Thursday.

title: Japan's space agency says it may now have clues about the origins of the moon
description: An unmanned lunar spacecraft has captured and transmitted data analyzing lunar rocks, an achievement that could help provide clues about the origin of the moon, a Japan space agency official said

title: Hurricane Idalia shows nature may provide the best shoreline protection
description: Researchers at the University of Florida found that nature-based "living shoreline" projects significantly reduced wave energy and were largely undamaged during Hurricane Idalia last year.

title: Special counsel asks Supreme Court to move quickly on the Trump immunity case
description: Special counsel Jack Smith urged the U.S. Supreme Court on Wednesday to let former President Donald Trump's 2020 election interference case proceed to trial without further delay.

title: Americans who live alone report depression at higher rates, but social support helps
description: The number of people living alone in the U.S. jumped to nearly 38 million. A new study shows people who live alone are more likely to report depression if they didn't have other social supports.

title: Photos: Shooting in Kansas City after Chiefs parade
description: One person was killed and at least 21 others were injured in the attack outside Union Station in Kansas City.

title: Maker of Tinder, Hinge sued over 'addictive' dating apps that put profits over love
description: Match Group was sued on Wednesday for violating consumer protection laws for allegedly addicting dating app users through "predatory" practices that mislead people searching for romantic partners.
